title: The Birthday Cake Catastrophe
setting: Hartley & Moore Accounting, break room, Thursday 3 PM
premise: Someone took a slice from the surprise birthday cake for Janet before the party started. The cake was delivered to the break room fridge at noon and the party was at 3 PM.

suspects.name: Walt Brennan
suspects.motive: Has a notorious sweet tooth and was caught eating office treats before
suspects.alibi: I was in back-to-back client meetings from 11 AM to 2:30 PM in the conference wing. My assistant booked all four meetings and sat in on two of them.

suspects.name: Donna Reeves
suspects.motive: Didn't know about the party and assumed the cake was up for grabs
suspects.alibi: I was at my desk all afternoon processing invoices. I did go to the break room at 1 PM to heat up my lunch, but the fridge was full so I used the microwave quickly and left.

suspects.name: Frankie Lau
suspects.motive: Janet rejected his idea for the office holiday party and he's still sore about it
suspects.alibi: I was sorting and delivering mail from noon to 2 PM. I hit every floor including the break room floor, but I only dropped off packages at the supply closet next door.

suspects.name: Irene Stokes
suspects.motive: Ordered the cake and wanted to 'quality check' it before the party
suspects.alibi: I was decorating the large conference room for Janet's party from 1 PM to 2:45 PM. Two colleagues helped me hang streamers and they were with me the whole time.

clues.title: Fridge Fingerprint
clues.content: A chocolate frosting smudge was found on the inside of the fridge door handle. The cake is a chocolate fudge cake with distinctive dark frosting.

clues.title: Colleague's Observation
clues.content: A colleague who microwaved lunch at 12:30 PM saw the cake fully intact with all slices. Another colleague opened the fridge at 2 PM and noticed a slice was missing.

clues.title: Break Room Visit
clues.content: Donna says she only used the microwave at 1 PM and didn't open the fridge because it was too full. But she would have needed to open the fridge to know it was full in the first place.
